Oklahoma: s daily caseload has risen consistently in June, contradicting the claim that the number of cases has declined precipitously.
The raw data from the Covid Tracking Pro: confirmed cases has not significantly declined but rather remained relatively stable from early April to the end of May.
The term: flattening the curve" refers to the phenomenon of keeping new infections from overwhelming the hospital system by reducing the spread of the virus. While there was a decrease in cases during the mentioned period, it was not a significant decline.
